comment.body: It looks you are only marking the files not in `external` directories, correct? qtesla doesn't use an external directory, but instead uses a `portable` and `avx2` one. Perhaps these should be moved down into an `external` folder for consistency, and not have the license applied to each external file.

pull_request.title: Add SPDX-License-Identifier headers
pull_request.body:
Fixes #642.

Before merging:

- [ ] Update [coding conventions wiki page](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Coding-conventions)

comment.body: This seem to indicate that all the file is Apache, but the readme says this file "includes portions which are Apache License v2.0". Which one is correct?

pull_request.title: Add SPDX-License-Identifier headers
pull_request.body:
Fixes #642.

Before merging:

- [ ] Update [coding conventions wiki page](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Coding-conventions)

comment.body:
Is that compatible with the [SPDX IDs](https://spdx.org/ids) usage? The page says one ID per file. [This page](https://spdx.org/ids-how) suggests we should use conditionals, e.g.:
`// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 AND MIT`

pull_request.title: Add SPDX-License-Identifier headers
pull_request.body:
Fixes #642.

Before merging:

- [ ] Update [coding conventions wiki page](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Coding-conventions)

comment.body: Oh, I hadn't seen that aspect of usage.  Yes, let's change the top of the file to be Apache-2.0 AND MIT.
